Description: Fragment of very tall lip of South Ionian pottery chalice-cup; interior: glazed black; exterior: dilute lines; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see British Museum 1886,0401.329 and 360; it may be from the same cup as the latter. Such sherds have been identified as kantharoi by some scholars and as chalice cups by others. The horizontal handle usually found suggests that these are chalice cups. According to Schlotzhauer (2012, 115) locally made chalices have been found at Miletus, but not with this form of decoration.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 716, no. 742)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.734) (phase 3)
